address: Dipartimento di Scienze chimiche, fisiche, matematiche e naturali, ,
bio:
I am a Tenure-Track Assistant Professor (RTDb) at the University of Sassari, Dipartimento di Scienze Chimiche, Fisiche, Matematiche e Naturali, (January 2022-ongoing).

I was an Assistant Professor (RTDa) at the University of Basilicata, Department of Mathematics, Informatics and Economics (July 2019-December 2021).

In my postdoctoral experience, I have spent time at the University of Padua in the Prof. MG. Pedersen group, shifting my interests to a new field on mathematical modeling of subcellular and cellular systems responsible for hormone secretion. (March 2017-July 2019).

I have completed my PhD in mathematics at the University of Torino in February 2017, under the supervision of Prof. Ezio Venturino. (January 2014-December 2016)
In my PhD thesis, I have considered a number of problems in mathematical biology. The first part of the thesis is concerned with biological wastewater bioremediation using fungi. The second part of the dissertation considers problems in ecology, for interacting populations.

I have completed my Master of Science in Mathematics at the University of Torino under the supervision of Prof. Elena Cordero (2013).

My research area of interest includes: Graph signal processing; Time-frequency analysis; Gabor frames and applications; Mathematical modeling with applications to: cancer; Covid-19; electrical activity and Ca+ dynamics in endocrine cells; epidemiology; ecology; eco-epidemiologi; etc. Slow/fast bifurcation analysis; excitation waves
